books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university. Read by Julia Whelan. 12 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EDUCATED

books.author: Philip Rucker and Carol Leonnig
books.contributor: by Philip Rucker and Carol Leonnig
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists use firsthand accounts to chart patterns of behavior within the Trump administration. Read by Hillary Huber and the authors. 17 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: A VERY STABLE GENIUS

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: Ronan Farrow
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter details some surveillance and intimidation tactics used to pressure journalists and elude consequences by certain wealthy and connected men. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CATCH AND KILL

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Unexpected factors that explain why some people succeed, such as upbringing, timing and 10,000 hours of deliberate practice. Read by the author. 7 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIERS

books.author: David Enrich
books.description: The New York Times finance editor traces the history and illicit dealings of Deutsche Bank. Read by B.J. Harrison. 13 hours, 11 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DARK TOWERS

books.author: Erik Larson
books.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill. Read by John Lee and the author. 17 hours and 49 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE

books.author: Matthew Walker
books.description: A neuroscientist uses recent scientific discoveries to explain the functions of sleep and dreams. Read by Steve West. 13 hours, 52 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHY WE SLEEP

books.author: S.C. Gwynne
books.description: The story of Quanah Parker, the last chief of the Comanches. Read by David Drummond. 15 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EMPIRE OF THE SUMMER MOON

books.author: Ezra Klein
books.description: The editor at large and co-founder of Vox offers his take on what causes divisions in America. Read by the author. 8 hours, 32 minutes unabridged.

books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
